stanza.line: That thereby beauty rose might never die
But as the riper should by timedecease
His tender heir might bear his memory
But thou contracted to thine own brighteyes
Feed thy light flame with self substantialfuel
Thy self thy foe to thy sweet self toocruel
Thou that art now the world fresh ornament
And only herald to the gaudy spring
Within thine own bud buriest thy content
And tender churl mak waste in niggarding
Pity the world or else this gluttonbe
To eat the world due by the grave andthee
